abstract: Catalyst Pharmaceuticals has completed application for formal FDA approval of neuromuscular disease treatment drug, called Firdapse, raising fears among patients of steep price increase and calls from doctors for fair pricing; application is for slightly modified version of drug that Jacobus Pharmaceutical has been giving away for free; Jacobus says it will also seek approval, beginning showdown that illustrates growing debate over rising drug prices.
lead_paragraph: A showdown between two drug companies, one that gives away a treatment for a rare disease and another looking to profit from it, illustrates the growing tension over the rising prices of drugs.

headline.main: Patients Fear Spike in Price of Old Drugs
headline.print_headline: Patients Fear Spike in Price of Old Drugs

snippet: A showdown between two drug companies, one that gives away a treatment for a rare disease and another looking to profit from it, illustrates the growing tension over the rising prices of drugs.
